website_summaries.verdict: A helpful gadget for athletes and those engaging in sports, but not as a medical device.
pros: Exceptionally accurate O2 readings, particularly at high altitudes
Multi-direction display goes beyond basic O2 saturation and pulse readings
cons: Several reports of faulty units, so test it out thoroughly to ensure you didn't get a dud

customer_reviews.title: Product reads slightly higher than standard medical equipment on O2 and pulse
customer_reviews.text: Not made to use on self since the display is facing away from you. works fine if you're using it on another person so you can read it. Accuracy is slightly off compared to hospital and or doctor's office equipment reads slightly higher 02 and pulse.
customer_reviews.author: G.A.B

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Work!
customer_reviews.text: I just received my pulse oximeter from you and after reading and following the instructions explicitly the product failed to work! It indicated faulty batteries so I tested them and even tried replacing them with new ones, but it still didn't work. I tested the batteries with my battery tester and all registered strong and functional. My conclusion is that I received a faulty product and I am returning it for a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Abigail T.

customer_reviews.title: No home should not be without it
customer_reviews.text: I use it all the time. My physical therapists says good product
customer_reviews.author: Duane

customer_reviews.title: Accuracy
customer_reviews.text: I think it is okay, I just don't know how accurate it is
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate
customer_reviews.text: As far as the pulse ox is concerned, it is not accurate. Pulse is accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Goli

customer_reviews.title: TOTAL JUNK
customer_reviews.text: I've had two and had to return them both. The second one just told me my pulse was 08 and my oxygen level was L8. Seriously? And, yes, I tried it many more times and each time the readout was crazy.
customer_reviews.author: hideovideo

customer_reviews.title: Office quality
customer_reviews.text: I took this into my doctors office and found it was just as accurate as the ones that they used in the office.
customer_reviews.author: Eastern Washington Disabled Veteran

customer_reviews.title: Ok product
customer_reviews.text: print seems backwards when I am trying to read it for self measuring
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Received a defective PulseOx
customer_reviews.text: I had to return the product as I received it due to device malfunction. I followed instructions manual precisely and tried using multiple different batteries (new) and could not get it to turn on. It is unacceptable to send dysfunctional devices.
customer_reviews.author: raghad

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny and holds up well.
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I use this as a Respiratory Therapist every day at the hospital on hundred of patients and have purchased this pulse odometer multiple times when they wear out after heavy use. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Average Joe Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Great product and price can't be beat. I do all my shopping on Amazon. Prices and customer service way better than Walmart.
customer_reviews.author: J Tussey

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Work
customer_reviews.text: Did not work, straight out of the box, tried the supplied batteries, display lights (no numbers) came on for few seconds and then shut off. Replaced batteries with New Duracell ones and same thing. This unit does not work
customer_reviews.author: alan c

customer_reviews.title: great for the money
customer_reviews.text: Reads well and is Identical to the one we use in the clinic. I am in med school, and am slowly building a car first aid bag. I found this oximeter for 13$ on lightning deal and snatched it up. It is identical to the one we use in clinic but for much cheaper. It reads well, takes AA batteries and comes with a carrying case. the only con is that the display can be mis-read because the numbers are the same. 68 can be read upside down as 89, etc. other than that. it is great.
customer_reviews.author: savings monger

customer_reviews.title: Oxygen reading dont work right
customer_reviews.text: The main reason i bought this for it dont work that being the oxygen reading it reads 20 to 25 points lower than my home nurses has on her oxymeater only thing close to being right is pulse rate
customer_reviews.author: Michael W Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Underwhelming
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made. Parts did not fit together well. Did not work when turned on. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Target

customer_reviews.title: Broken
customer_reviews.text: This is cheaply made. Did not work when I received it. And I have gotten no response from the company about a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Heather M Baker

customer_reviews.title: FL400 Pulse Oxymeter
customer_reviews.text: This FL400 Pulse Ox comes with its own small bag, batteries and lanyard. It's powered by two triple A batteries. The numbers are labeled hence it's easy to know which is the oxygen sat and which is the heart rate. Since the numbers are labeled, one won't err though viewing it upside down. The pulse ox is readily convenient for the use of a lay person. It provides a reading for 2 parameters: oxygen saturation & pulse rate/ minute. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: PickyjadeTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: It seems fine.  Use it (on you) plus a CO2 monitor(and CO?) to understand your indoor air quality
customer_reviews.text: It seems fine. If you have it (for O2), a mini CO2 monitor, and a CO monitor, you should have a pretty good picture of the quality of the air that you and yours are breathing.
customer_reviews.author: A. New

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Two of us have had this for 10 days, have used it for readings several times day. The readings are all over the map, some normal, some so low it would place in the 'you have coronavirus range.' (90%). Later that same day, the readings are 98% again. This item does not seem reliable.
customer_reviews.author: skylight

customer_reviews.title: Broken after less than 3 months of use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in april and it broke after less than 3 months of use at work in a hospital floor (I am a registered nurse). Cheap quality. I suggest buying a more sturdy one if you plan on using it regularly at work.
customer_reviews.author: GK625

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate enough.
customer_reviews.text: Item I’ve compared it to is a medical grade oximeter. The pulse was off by quite a bit but O2 seemed accurate (also compared to a digital blood pressure cuff...but I know they can be off). Box says device is ONLY for sports and aviation use. Not sure what this means. Because I need this item for EMT use I’ll be returning it...it’s unacceptable to be off by this much.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Crazy battery contacts
customer_reviews.text: The battery compartment has two springs at on end and two buttons at the other but apparently one of the springs is supposed to connect with the positive end of the battery. This is obviously an error in manufacture. It does work with this setup but the readings aren't accurate compared with other oximeters. Might be OK to follow a trend in oxygenation but not for absolute numbers.
customer_reviews.author: plevee

customer_reviews.title: B’cos of popularity they are now shipping fake product?
customer_reviews.text: I hope 5000 people were not fooled into writing good reviews and the problem I had is a more recent trend. I was prompted to test my pulse oxymeter with an inanimate object! Apparently my pen (a non working one at that!) has an oxygen level of 68 and needs to be taken to an ICU! :D
customer_reviews.author: I luv roses

customer_reviews.title: Works well. seems to be accurate
customer_reviews.text: Product seems to work well. I cannot vouch for its accuracy because I have not had the chance to calibrate with an official machine. However, the heart rate is usually with 1 or 2 beats of what I palpate or auscultate. The SpO2 also seems to be within normal limits. I therefore imagine that it is accurate... but again, I cannot guarantee. I would suggest calibrating by yourself to be safe.
customer_reviews.author: ary

customer_reviews.title: Helped to convince my husband to go to ER
customer_reviews.text: Although my husband was having a lot of difficulty breathing, he repeatedly refused to go to the ER. After receiving this pulse oximeter, I put it on his finger and got a reading. When I called the nurse healthline and told her that his reading was 67, she insisted that my husband should go to the ER immediately. That finally convinced him. He is now in intensive care being treated for covid-19. The oximeter is very easy to use, and I am happy to recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: LR

customer_reviews.title: Low Quality
customer_reviews.text: First, it’s flimsy. Already springs have sprung and poked my finger. Wasn’t looking for blood — just wanted some info. Second, it’s slow to read and will change its reading several times if you restart it. Not talking a few beats. More like 30. Third, it only reads in one direction which is upside down if you’re trying to monitor yourself. Buying another one from somewhere else. $$$ down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: Miss_Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last long
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to keep in our kit. When it arrived I put the battery in it and it seemed to work fine. A couple of weeks later I used it again and it worked fine and I took the battery out of it. A year later I put a fresh battery in it and it was dead and wouldn't do anything.
customer_reviews.author: D Marquis

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: Takes forever to read. Then the readings are off. Says 98-99 and nurses say 88 or lower. I needed this to know if my oxygen or anyone in my family that has asthma if their oxygen was good. Can't rely on this. It's very cheaply made as well.
customer_reviews.author: Dunn83

customer_reviews.title: RETURNED -- Scarily inaccurate!
customer_reviews.text: Returned this oximeter due to extremely erratic readings. Oxygen levels of 56, 63, 72??!! Even pulse readings were WAY off. FYI= Used MD-tested older oximeter to compare. For someone at home self-monitoring for covid-virus, this equipment will cause unnecessary alarm. Oximeters are notoriously unreliable, but this one was worse than most (have bought many over the years for mother with severe COPD, so know). I do NOT recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Steven D. Carrell

customer_reviews.title: DOESN'T WORK
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your time. This product doesn't work. Additionally, it feels light and flimsy. Very different from the ones they use in hospitals or doctor offices.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Goldberg

customer_reviews.title: Received quickly... BUT... it did not work
customer_reviews.text: Well, I got the product quickly however, it wouldn’t even turn on. The box was ripped and it looked like the device and the other material inside the box was just throw in.
customer_reviews.author: cawatson2

customer_reviews.title: Not What it Seems, Keep shopping!
customer_reviews.text: After you buy you read the fine print and its NOT for any medical use, just for athletes that want to check so2 after a work out. Too light for a paperweight...so....useless. And compared to a real monitor the pulse reading was off as much as 40 beats a minute.DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Readings are not accurate
customer_reviews.text: This device consistently scored anywhere from 15-20 points lower than a commercially available device that we have in my office that we distribute to patients. Since employees are not entitled to purchase the ones in my office, I purchased this one for my personal use. I wanted to monitor my pulse ox during exercise, which this one alleges is its purpose. The inaccuracy is certainly unacceptable, but the most disappointing part about this purchase is that it is labeled as an Amazon Choice. I feel that consumers are being misled.
customer_reviews.author: MrsFi

customer_reviews.title: Works fine. Take it to the Doctors office and it ...
customer_reviews.text: Works fine. Take it to the Doctors office and it is within a point or two of their reading. Only works in one direction. My previous one could be set to read at different angles
customer_reviews.author: J. T. Jones

customer_reviews.title: With the pouch I can keep it in my purse
customer_reviews.text: The Facelake FL400 Pulse Oximeter came as expected. I love the pouch it comes in so I can carry it with me in my purse. With needing to wear a mask everywhere now, I have been needing to check my O2 levels. I've had it for quite a while now and it seems like it is accurate but I have not been to the doctor to check it with theirs. My only negative for it is, many times I have to turn my finger sideways for it to read. I have small fingers and I'm assuming that is why. But I don't remember it being touchy at first.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with this product. It works just like the one in my doctors office. Accurate too. I have asthma and so its important to know O2 level and pulse. Works quickly, easy to use. Anyone can do it.
customer_reviews.author: Kayleen Higbee

customer_reviews.title: Basically a Toy
customer_reviews.text: This was a big disappointment. Despite a number of negative reviews here, I was optimistic that this would be a good quality and reliable device. It is not. Readings differ wildly from one use to the next and are seldom very accurate, particularly the oxygen level reading. As they say, you get what you pay for, and this device's low price did not pay for much. In my opinion, it is no better than having nothing to read my oxygen level, since I can't trust it. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Lost in Vegas

customer_reviews.title: My GP approves
customer_reviews.text: With TeleMed the rage because of Covid-19, I have been assigned to use virtual appointments via computer for most visits to my GP and others. So I need to present them with BP, Oxygen saturation, and temperature. The Facelake does the job and physicians are pleased I can provide them my vitals. The only thing to watch out for is the insertion of the batteries, so pay attention to the instructions. The device is easy to use and appears to be accurate. I believe anyone who purchases this device will be pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Hrothgar

customer_reviews.title: Accurate. Compared to Hospital Readings. Could Save Your Life!
customer_reviews.text: Accurate. Pulse matches up with my Apple watch. I bought this while I had COVID and it also matched up to the blood oxygen levels I saw while in the hospital. This thing could save your life. Highly recommend getting one if you have COVID or have chronic issues that cause your O2 levels to drop. You can't always tell. This will let you know when it's time to go to the hospital or whether things are fine so you can save yourself the trip.
customer_reviews.author: Hill

customer_reviews.title: Faulty screen, extremely poor build quality, terrible accuracy, very inconsistent results.
customer_reviews.text: Several segments of the display did not function, making it difficult to read the results. But even when they intermittently worked, the oxygen count fluctuated between wildly dangerous levels, and normal ones with readings within seconds of one another. The instructions were in cryptically poor English, to the point where it was difficult to even know which side of your finger the device wanted pointing up, and the case was so fragile that putting your finger in too far caused the sides to separate. The box it arrived in was undamaged, so I'm unable to simply dismiss all of this as shipping damage.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Works well, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: All three of us found it easy to use. It switches off about 5 sec after you take your finger out. Sit and rest for a while before taking your pulse and blood oxygen. The oxygen reading is consistent to about 2% for successive readings on the same finger. You may get slightly different oxygen readings from different fingers or from different hands. You may have a lower reading after exercise or at high elevation, such as 7000 ft above sea level. We did not try to use it during hiking or in the gym.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and appears to be accurate.
customer_reviews.text: The heart rate was exactly what my Fitbit said so either they are both wrong, or it's accurate. The display is easy to read and it does take about 30 seconds for it to register. It shows a blinking display to let you know it is working. The display is upside down if you are looking at your own finger. It's clearly made for a "nurse" to read it easily. That's not a problem though as you just move your finger. I also like that it turns off automatically.
customer_reviews.author: nwilkaz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: Tested it at the hospital and it was right on.
customer_reviews.author: Charles H. Rau

customer_reviews.title: Gives different readings within a few seconds of each other
customer_reviews.text: Readings taken within a few seconds vary by ten points between them in measuring blood oxygen. If you have smaller or slender fingers, it won't take a reading at all.
customer_reviews.author: Elsa Lin

customer_reviews.title: Shameful Quality x 2
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these for a "just in case" moment. Should have opened and tested them right away.. Needed them when my son showed cold symptoms. Do you think either of them worked? NO!! Again, my bad for not testing them out, but what a let down product when we needed it! What a shame?!!
customer_reviews.author: Lawyer Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Work!
customer_reviews.text: I could not get it to work - I put batteries in; it turns on and I got lights; but it would not register any numbers. My husband was able to get it to work on his finger, but not consistently. I don't know if it works better on larger fingers? I was very disappointed. I have returned mine. Disappointing as I waited a very long time and I think the price was too high - I was willing to pay more because so many are out of stock.
customer_reviews.author: Potami

customer_reviews.title: Works for Larger Fingers
customer_reviews.text: Works... as long as you have pretty large fingers. Difficult to get a reading on pediatric or smaller fingers. It would be nice if it could be read upside down. But that’s the case with most brands. The readout designed to be right side up for the care provider which makes it upside down for the wearer.
customer_reviews.author: Occasional Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Works fine. Got it for my brother who has COPD
customer_reviews.text: Works fine. Got it for my brother who has COPD. It's always been dead on or within 1 number of the Hospital's Oximeter. It help to reduce my brothers anxiety by seeing he's truly getting enough oxygen.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: since I have a larger and better pulse oxymeter to compare it to BUT the down ...
customer_reviews.text: I can say the pulse and O2 readings are accurate, since I have a larger and better pulse oxymeter to compare it to BUT the down side is that you can't see the display if there is even a slight bit of sun light
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money!! Don’t buy it!!
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money. Unfortunately I bought 3 of this oximeter. It simply does not work. Never gave an accurate reading. According to its reading, I would be dead by now, for such a low SpO2..... Spend your money buying a product that really works!!
customer_reviews.author: Marcos Correa

customer_reviews.title: Didn't realize until recently how cheap it was to have ...
customer_reviews.text: Didn't realize until recently how cheap it was to have an oximeter on me rather than chase the nurses down or go hunting for one if I need an O2 reading. This one works well and isn't too pricey.
customer_reviews.author: James T.

customer_reviews.title: fits nicely on my size 12 finger
customer_reviews.text: fits nicely on my size 12 finger, and takes just a few seconds to get a reading. I took it with me on my last doctor's check-up and the reading matched his oximeter exactly.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Hull

customer_reviews.title: The pulse oximeter
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this one to have a back up one have had one for about a year and love it works great have checked it with the one doctor uses and there about the same.
customer_reviews.author: STRONG BOY

customer_reviews.title: Offers reliable peace of mind in a few seconds.
customer_reviews.text: Great little gadget for measuring your pulse ox. Comes in a small carrying case to easily store in a purse, backpack or briefcase. It took a few practice attempts for my DH, DD to find the sweet spot to get their readings. Once the red bars light up, there is a brief delay before the reading appears. Originally bought this out of concern for Covid-19. It has turned into a fantastic way to practice and measure biofeedback results and stress levels.
customer_reviews.author: PGHRhonda

customer_reviews.title: No Off Switch But That's Ok
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't have an off switch but it shuts off in about 5 seconds if it doesn't detect a finger. So, in the case of accidentally being turned on, the battery won't be wasted.
customer_reviews.author: Heather C.

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly accurate
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up for a cheap training tool for teaching medical classes and because I was curious how well it would work because it’s so inexpensive. I compared this to the Philips MRx monitor on my ambulance and it was actually very close. Pulse was within 3-4 bpm and SpO2 was within 1-2 points as well. I gave it 5 stars even though it was a little slower updating than the MRx because for under $15 I’m quite impressed and comparing it to a machine that’s hundreds of times more expensive really isn’t fair. So far I would certainly buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It was one of the best things I ever bought her
customer_reviews.text: This product saved my mom's life. She suffered from respiratory issues and she would stare at this and watch as her oxygen levels came back up. It was her constant companion until the end. She showed it to everyone she met. It was one of the best things I ever bought her.
customer_reviews.author: PeachyGramma

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend you purchase this item
customer_reviews.text: I suffer from Asthma and I tried to use Apps with Sp02 reading option last night. Unfortunately, it wasn't accurate. Highly recommend you purchase this item. It worked well and arrived with nice holder.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: Have had this for about 8 months. I got it to measure my pulse ox. When my heath professional would use theirs I would use mine to see if it was doing its job and it matched every time. I also know the heart beat is accurate because I've matched that as well. It seems to be built well and I like the carrying case along with the rope to put it around my neck. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Holly H.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love it. I have asthma so it helps me know where I'm at when in sick. Great price too!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca B

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Pretty accurate once you can get it to read. It is a little finicky but a good way to double check a reading. Pretty accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa L.

customer_reviews.title: How To SELF read meter
customer_reviews.text: Meter is design for others to read when your hand is the flat position. For self reading turn hand over (face up) and curl the fingers toward you so your finger tips are pointed toward you. Use at room temps. When Mom was dehydrated (skin test) Ox reading got down in the 80"s. Same with cold hands indoors. Have not tried this suppler.
customer_reviews.author: john t

customer_reviews.title: Makes an ill person happy!
customer_reviews.text: My friend has to monitor his pulse and oxygen level regularly. The odometer does the job of more expensive units. He thanked me profusely when I gave this odometer to him... thanks go to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: M. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Love the carrying case that come with the unit
customer_reviews.text: I take this thing everywhere. Everyone should have one. Love the carrying case that come with the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This project seemed great when I first got it but approximately a week ...
customer_reviews.text: This project seemed great when I first got it but approximately a week afterwards it came apart and hasn't worked right since then. I noticed it was very cheaply made so I guess that's why it came apart when I put it on a pt's finger. I will probably never purchase from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sufficient for needs
customer_reviews.text: Price was right and does what programmed to do PLUS, gives heart rate that can be compared to blood pressure cuff.
customer_reviews.author: NaNi Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Works great - Priced to please
customer_reviews.text: Easy to read and results are quick. Very reasonable priced. My husband paid more than twice the price this one cost and it's not any better.
customer_reviews.author: Ramona Kuhn

customer_reviews.title: I'd recommend
customer_reviews.text: I cannot vouch for the accuracy. It seems to be correct. I it doesn't have to be 100% for my needs. I am not a medical professional. This is for my personal use. It is as described. It is easy to use and I must admit I love the carrying case. At this time, I'm not taking it any where but I still like it safe in a case. I would recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: LISA

customer_reviews.title: Great product, easy to use, great price!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my sister-in-law with congestive heart failure. Works great. Gives us all peace of mind knowing she can check her heart rate and oxygen saturation at any time. Great price and easy to use. Thank u!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie W.

customer_reviews.title: Great value!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I 've found the Oximeter to be very accurate and easy to use......It's helped me a lot with my recovery and I hope that with it's continued help that I will be healthier than before! I've also found , with the help of my nurse, that this meter is more accurate than one supplied by the hospital for their testing.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Gierszewski

customer_reviews.title: Cheap/not worth your time
customer_reviews.text: Cheap and inaccurate. I have asthma and with the virus, I thought this would be additional information. This was a total waste of money as only the pulse seems reasonably accurate and I and get that anywhere
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn ATL

customer_reviews.title: Extremely East to Use
customer_reviews.text: This FL400 Pulse Oximeter is simple to use - put your finger in the clamp, press the white button and wait about 30 seconds for things to settle down and you are done. Display is upside down while finger is in the clamp, but that is not an issue unless for some reason you cannot read upside down. Provides pulse rate and oxygen concentration in the blood. Just make sure you wait about 30 seconds or longer before noting the reading to let it stabilize.
customer_reviews.author: Brintkt

customer_reviews.title: Lots of value
customer_reviews.text: Tested this oximeter against 3 others used by medical professionals during a recent hospitalization. Reading were identical.
customer_reviews.author: John Kilvik

customer_reviews.title: Great to Have at Home
customer_reviews.text: While reading up on Coved-19 one statement spurred me to buy this. A lack of oxygen in your body was going unnoticed like a silent thief and the person was unaware themselves until it was advanced and progressing into a stated of sever oxygen depletion situation. Having this at home makes me feel more in control and aware of how my body is working.
customer_reviews.author: Tehachapi

customer_reviews.title: Totally inaccurate!
customer_reviews.text: Looks good and functions well, but it is totally inaccurate. Measures 3 to 4 points low. Plus if you leave your finger in it a minute or so the value changes. I am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: GP

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.text: If you have breathing or respiratory problems you should have a Pulse Oximeter. It isn’t the fanciest but it does the job. The number might be off by a digit or two from the super fancy expensive variety - but if you are in respiratory distress it will let you know... But if you want one on hand in a first aid kit this will work great. So I’m happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Alice in Alabama

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, but could have been better
customer_reviews.text: This product gets the job done - that is giving the reading for Oxygen Saturation and HeartBeat. But the build quality is not great. It comes with a pouch which is nice. Also, the reading is upside down so the person testing cannot view it in the right orientation, but I guess all machines are like that. Somehow integrating a auto orientation feature would be nice.
customer_reviews.author: Fiaz

customer_reviews.title: Everybody Needs This
customer_reviews.text: Got this after my wife had a stroke. She is on oxygen and this lets us know between doctor visits how she is doing. Helped me to be aware of how my oxygen levels are doing as well.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: easy for others to read
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is that when you use it on yourself the numbers are upside down to you. It's meant to be read by someone else. Other than that its great. I assume it's accurate, I haven't tested it against anything else but seems right. Easy to use and turns off automatically to save battery life. Comes with a cord to carry around your neck.
customer_reviews.author: dragracemom

customer_reviews.title: It Seems to Work
customer_reviews.text: This was shipped quickly and is easy to use. I have no way to calibrate it or check accuracy. The readings it gives seem reasonable. It has a little case and a lanyard. Instructions say this is for non-medical use in healthy individuals. If you have a medical condition you should buy a better one. This is good for me. Made in China.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Work
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these because I was going to give one to sister. One gave a reading once then never again. Second one couldn't get to work at all. Changed batteries a couple of times...no luck. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Charlene

customer_reviews.title: I worried it would be hard to read. I shouldn't have.
customer_reviews.text: Simple, quick, sure. I haven't had a chance to measure it against my doc's version, but every indication I have is that it will pass the test. All the warnings from others had me worried I would have trouble reading it, but that turned out to be an insignificant concern. All you need to do if you're reading your own is to turn it in your direction. Problem solved. I'm pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Borden

customer_reviews.title: This device is very easy to use and read.  Peace of mind. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Low Oxygen levels are one of the first sign of possibly having coved 19. Or so I’ve heard. Fever too of course, however, if you have a fever you already know you have something. We check our oxygen level and pulse rate every morning and every evening. This device is very easy to use and read. Peace of mind. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be accurate
customer_reviews.text: It seems to be accurate for pulse. I compare to my running chest strap/watch combo - chest straps are usually the most accurate. they read almost the same. not sure about the oxygen measure. I plan to compare to what my doctor's instruments say next time I'm in the office. but the numbers appear to be accurate. l
customer_reviews.author: Chuck in the Rockies

customer_reviews.title: Well made, fast and accurate.
customer_reviews.text: Fast, easy to read, solid construction. Readings match what they get at the doctor's office, so it seems to be quite accurate. Note - not for small children (but clearly labeled as such).
customer_reviews.author: Tim Post

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Covers what it was needed for. Easy to use right out the box.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty great! Better than the one I got at a big box store with more features for cheaper
customer_reviews.text: Pretty great. Even shows the lines (graph i guess) of your heartbeat as it beats and it automatically switches orientation (landscape to portrait) in 3 directions as you move your finger so you can read it. Not too heavy. Seems pretty accurate and even the graph function seems incredibly responsible in real time
customer_reviews.author: missyj95

customer_reviews.title: Does  the job!
customer_reviews.text: My mom needed this and she is happy with this one. The only thing I think would make it better is if the readout was turned so the person wearing it didn't have to look at it upside down. She is older (as are most who have to use these things) and it is hard for her to see anyway. Otherwise, works great!
customer_reviews.author: TKay

customer_reviews.title: Useful during COVID
customer_reviews.text: We ordered one of these along with an IR thermometer for daily use during COVID. Seems to work fine, although nothing to compare the readings to for accuracy. Quickly measures blood oxygen level and pulse rate. Gives us confidence that we're still okay while sheltering at home, which makes it worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: MikeH

customer_reviews.title: This device is working good!
customer_reviews.text: I had a Doctor Appointment and took my Oxygen Meter with me,it was showing the same number's as the doctor office instruments. Good assurance!
customer_reviews.author: Erika Barthelmas

customer_reviews.title: Nice to have
customer_reviews.text: Yep, I purchased this to keep track of all our oxygen levels because of Covid-19. It is easy to use, read and does not hurt your finger. I wish I had purchased two.
customer_reviews.author: E. Conrad

customer_reviews.title: Not for me maybe my fingers are too small.
customer_reviews.text: It didn’t work for me I am sticking with my old big monster machine. When I contacted the site they were very understanding. Good people to deal with.
customer_reviews.author: mysay

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Delivery and Product
customer_reviews.text: The Facelake FL400 arrived one day early, which is excellent for a consumer medical device in these times of global pandemic. Everything in the package was in order, the manual was easy to read, and it appeared to work very well. I have no other device to gauge it against, but based on recent use of similar medical grade equipment at the hospital, it appears to be accurate.
customer_reviews.author: G Jones

customer_reviews.title: I do like this meter and the very nice carrying case that ...
customer_reviews.text: Works very well for my needs. I am on oxygen therapy and need to keep track of my oxygen levels. I have noticed that the pulse rate usually registers two to three points higher than my fitbit does so the next time I go to the doctors I will have the oxygen level checked against theirs to see how close it is. I do like this meter and the very nice carrying case that came with it.
customer_reviews.author: SandyW

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I've seen a lot of complaints that the readout is difficult to read as it's upside down, but it really isn't difficult at all. It seems to be pretty accurate. If you get a lower than normal reading on O2, just patiently wait and it will usually get a more accurate reading if you sit still and measure for a few more seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Nina McCollum

customer_reviews.title: It is intended for non-medical use in healthy individuals to monitor pulse & oxygen levels
customer_reviews.text: I traveled 35 miles to a doctor appt to have them put a device like this on me only to tell me my oxygen level is ok. So I bought one to monitor my levels myself. I find it most informative to get a quick count on my pulse and oxygen levels. It lets me know why I feel the way I do and when to slow down.
customer_reviews.author: James Conn

customer_reviews.title: Ease of Access
customer_reviews.text: For someone who was just simply told by the doctor to buy one of these things - at first you put the batteries that it COMES WITH (no need to purchase batteries) and then you put your finger in the spot and press the small button. It doesn't specifically tell you which number is which for the oxygen level, but it is the bottom number for those who are wondering.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Beyond Pleased With Everything
customer_reviews.text: Thank you for the expedited delivery! I ordered this from another seller ( frlife - US) and not only did it take 11 days past the expected delivery date to receive, it didn’t work! So I ordered your item the same day that I realized I had an oximeter that Would not even turn on! Your shipping was excellent and the oximeter you shipped works perfectly! I am beyond pleased!!! Thank you so so much!! I highly recommend this seller and their items!! I would warn everyone to stay away from frlife-US!! They do not honor their word and they do not respond when you message them!!!
customer_reviews.author: Aimee Lee

customer_reviews.title: This works very well and I am very happy that I decided to check with Amazon smile
customer_reviews.text: I saw the same item at Walgreen' s for $89. This works very well and I am very happy that I decided to check with Amazon smile.What a bargain! It works great and it is accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient for home use
customer_reviews.text: Very good product. I bought this for my Uncle who is diabetic and before all this crazy virus started. It came quick, well made and was a great price. After this virus hit you could not find one less than $40.00. Thank you again for giving good products with reasonable pricing.
customer_reviews.author: nancy

product_meta.title: Facelake ® FL400 Pulse Oximeter with Carrying Case, Batteries, Neck/Wrist Cord - Blue
feature_bullets: ACCURATE SPO2: Determine your blood oxygen saturation levels (SPO2) and pulse rate.
SPORT/HEALTH ENTHUSIASTS : For enthusiast runners, bikers, swimmers, and others looking to monitor their SPO2 and pulse rate on the go.
EASY TO USE: Simple fingertip insert with results in under 10 seconds on a large LED display.
FREE ACCESSORIES: Includes 2x AAA batteries, nylon carrying case, lanyard, and user manual.
1 YEAR WARRANTY: Every pulse oximeter is inspected, warrantied, and serviced by our US based support team available in Illinois by phone and e-mail.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
